intro: Samyda macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered samyda, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Samyda macrantha is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
